metadata.Title: CVE-2022-41723 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A maliciously crafted HTTP/2 stream could cause excessive CPU consumption in the HPACK decoder, sufficient to cause a denial of service from a small number of small requests.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-41723` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-golang-x-net-dev - 1:0.7.0+dfsg-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> google-guest-agent contains a vendored copy of golang-golang-x-net mdeslaur> containerd does not listen on an HTTP/2 endpoint, so not vulnerable. This is fixed in the 20230426.00-0ubuntu packages currently in the -updates pocket, but is not yet fixed in -security

criterions.comment: golang-golang-x-net package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:0.7.0+dfsg-1').
google-guest-agent package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
